title: Uber suffers computer system breach, alerts authorities
description: The company said it was responding to a "cybersecurity incident."

title: ‘Metal: Hellsinger’ is heavy metal theatrics at their finest
description: Forget Guitar Hero and Rock Band: This rhythmic first-person shooter veers surprisingly close to the heart-palpitating sensation of playing music live.

title: Is Amazon Prime worth it for you?
description: If you're paying for Amazon Prime, or considering signing up, use this quiz to find out how much that $139 a year actually gets you and if there are better deals.

title: ‘Warzone 2.0′s’ Gulag, proximity chat, new modes and more
description: Everything that's coming soon to Call of Duty.

title: ‘Warzone 2.0’: ‘The most ambitious release in Call of Duty history’
description: The sequel to 'Warzone' will release Nov. 16, roughly four weeks after the launch of "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II."

title: White House announces tech company efforts to combat violent extremism
description: The announcements reflect a growing push from the Biden administration to examine the link between online rhetoric and mass shootings.

title: Customs officials have copied Americans’ phone data at massive scale
description: U.S. government officials are adding data from as many as 10,000 electronic devices each year to a massive database they’ve compiled from travelers' devices.

title: Silicon Valley can’t keep track of your data
description: Twitter whistleblower Peiter Zatko was asked repeatedly about whether Twitter is aware of how its user data is accessed and stored. He gave a troublesome answer: The company doesn’t know. Experts say the problem is bigger than Twitter.
